channel.title: Help don't really know how to describe it...Will REP++
channel.description: Okay so I'm trying to make this door open but when I compile it says "Duplicate case label" and yes I know what it means. But how would I make it so I can use that door also though. Their both the same object but in different places. I didn't originally place them there, they are Yanille Doors. ID= 1533 Thanks guys!

item.title: Help don't really know how to describe it...Will REP++
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

To have it open properly, you would have to edit doors.cfg not ActionHandler.class. But if you still want to use ActionHandler, add a check for the position.

Like.

case ObjectId:
if(obX == c.absX + 1 && obY == c.absY + 1) {
}
break;

Read full topic
item.source: Help don't really know how to describe it...Will REP++

item.title: Help don't really know how to describe it...Will REP++
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Wasn’t able to find the method for entering and leaving with the same object, but perhaps go to the extreme and add a right click ‘enter’ and ‘leave’ option via Objectdef.class <- think that’s correct.

if (i == objectID) { objectDef.name = "ObjectName"; }

Although that seems like alot to go through for just a door, if all else fails I’d just add a portal on the other side of the door.

Read full topic
item.source: Help don't really know how to describe it...Will REP++
